text: Sharing my view as a teacher of the Graduate Diploma in Compliance in Financial Services: WMI provides a highly professional learn environment with a strong focus on sharing practical know-how for industry experts. I always enjoy the lively and engaging sessions, continue the good work!

How can anyone trust them to teach wealth management when they can't even manage themselves is beyond me.

Cannot even confirm class timetable, with multiple reschedules with no notice or reason given, students have to chase for any information at all, and correspondences take up to a month, with no resolution provided.

Very irresponsible and terrible planning on the organisation's part. Many of the students do have full-time jobs and had signed up for the course with the schedule provided at the time to plan for their own time. This has now been terribly disrupted by the irresponsible planning by this institute.

Very poor. Numerous emails ignored. A continous chase for course updates. (For courses already paid for). No replies received.

Materials removed from student portal without notice / explanation. Sadly, very unprofessional.

As an industry professional, the WMI approach tarnishes both SG Wealth Mgt sector, and that of the country's brand. WMI is not up to Singapore standards.
Great learning experience with fellows advisors.
Congratulations Wealth Management Institute on the official launch of your new campus at One Marina Boulevard!
